headline.main: Trial Near in New Legal Tack in Tobacco War

docs.abstract: Class-action suit, first against tobacco industry, seeks $5 billion on behalf of estimated 60,000 current and former nonsmoking flight attendants for effects of smoke that they inhaled before 1990, when smoking was legal on most flights; trial is scheduled to begin in Dade County, Fla, Circuit Court on June 2; photo of flight attendant Norma Broin (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Norma Broin has been a flight attendant for American Airlines for 21 years. As a devout Mormon, she has never smoked a cigarette, ''never even a puff.'' Yet in 1989, she was given a diagnosis of lung cancer, and surgeons removed part of a lung.
